org.epics.ioc.pdrv
Interface User

public interface User

An interface for making PDRV (Port Driver) requests and for communication between driver and user. The PDRV rules ensure that at any given time at most one user is the "owner" of a port. Only the owner is allow to call the I/O interfaces implemented by the port/device driver. While owner a user can make an arbitrary number of calls to the port/device interfaces. Each PDRV user must create a User instance by calling Factory.createUser. Locking rules:

  • A user owns the port because of 1) it called port.lockPort or 2) The users queueRequestCallback is active.
  • connectPort, connectDevice, disconnectDevice, and disconnectPort can all be called without owning the port.
  • duplicateUser can safely be called if no connect or disconnect can occur while the duplicateUser is active.
  • All other methods should only be called either while the user owns the port or by the user when no queueRequest is active.
  • A user can call port and device interface methods only while it owns the port. Also some port and device methods may require that the caller own the port.
port.lockPort should be called via the following pattern: 
     port.lockport(user)
     try {
         // calls to port and/or device
     } finally {
         port.unlock(user)
     }

Author:
mrk

Constant Field Values
Method Detail

duplicateUser

User duplicateUser(QueueRequestCallback queueRequestCallback)
Create a new User that is connected to the same port and device. The new user will also have the same reason and timeout as the original.

Parameters:
queueRequestCallback - The callback for queueRequest.
Returns:
The new User.

connectPort

Port connectPort(java.lang.String portName)
Connect the user to a port.

Parameters:
portName - The portName.
Returns:
An interface to the port or null if the port does not exist.

disconnectPort

void disconnectPort()
Disconnect this user from the port. If a queueRequest is outstanding it is canceled.

getPort

Port getPort()
Get the port to which this user is connected.

Returns:
The port or null if the user is not connected to a port.

connectDevice

Device connectDevice(java.lang.String deviceName)
Connect the user to a device.

Parameters:
deviceName - The device deviceName.
Returns:
An interface to the device or null if the device does not exist.

disconnectDevice

void disconnectDevice()
Disconnect this user from the device.

getDevice

Device getDevice()
Get the device to which this user is connected.

Returns:
The device or null if the user is not connected to a device.

queueRequest

void queueRequest(QueuePriority queuePriority)
Queue a request for a port.

Parameters:
queuePriority - The priority.

cancelRequest

void cancelRequest()
Cancel a queueRequest. This must be called with the port unlocked.

lockPort

Status lockPort()
lockPort with permission to perform IO. The request will fail for any of the following reasons:
  • The port and/or device is not enabled
  • The device is blocked by another user
  • The port and/or device is not connected.
It will attempt to connect if autoConnect is true.

Returns:
Status.success if the port is connected, enabled, and not blocked by another user.

lockPortForConnect

Status lockPortForConnect()
lockPort with permission to call port.connect.

Returns:
success if user is connected to a port and it is not connected.

lockDeviceForConnect

Status lockDeviceForConnect()
lockPort with permission to call device.connect.

Returns:
success if user is connected to a device and it is not connected.

unlockPort

void unlockPort()
Unlock the port.

message - The message.

setPortDriverPvt

void setPortDriverPvt(java.lang.Object portDriverPvt)
Set a reference to a portDriverPrivate object. A driver must never keep information about a user within the driver. Instead it should use setPortDriverPvt and getPortDriverPvt.

Parameters:
portDriverPvt - The object.

getPortDriverPvt

java.lang.Object getPortDriverPvt()
Get the reference to the portDriverPvt object.

Returns:
Return a reference to portDriverPvt object.

Parameters:
deviceDriverPvt - The deviceDriverPvt.

setReason

void setReason(int reason)
Reason is for optional use by user/driver communication. Both user and driver must understand how it is used in order for it to be useful.

Parameters:
reason - The reason.

Get the reason.
